candidates.definition: Organizations established primarily for commercial, financial, or economic activities and profit generation.

positive_examples: Apple Inc. reported record quarterly earnings last week.
The startup is seeking Series A funding from venture capitalists.
Microsoft announced a merger with the software company.
The corporation's stock price jumped after the earnings call.
Small businesses struggled during the economic downturn.
The investment firm manages billions in assets.
negative_examples: The Red Cross provided disaster relief to flood victims.
Students protested outside the university administration building.
The military deployed troops to the border region.
Doctors Without Borders treated patients in refugee camps.
The city council voted on the new housing ordinance.
NASA launched another space exploration mission.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: GovernmentOrganization, NonProfitOrganization, EducationalInstitution, MilitaryOrganization, ReligiousOrganization

candidates.definition: Organizations that are part of or authorized by government to perform official functions or regulatory duties.

positive_examples: The Federal Communications Commission regulates broadcasting standards.
The Department of Transportation oversees highway safety regulations.
Congress passed new legislation on environmental protection.
The Patent and Trademark Office approved the new invention filing.
The Metropolitan Transportation Authority announced service changes.
A special commission was formed to investigate the banking crisis.
negative_examples: Microsoft Corporation released its quarterly earnings report.
The Red Cross provided disaster relief to flood victims.
Harvard University announced new admission policies.
The local church organized a community food drive.
Amazon hired thousands of new warehouse workers.
The neighborhood association held its annual meeting.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Corporation, NonProfit, EducationalInstitution, ReligiousOrganization

candidates.definition: Organizations that provide assistance, support, or specialized services to people or other entities.

positive_examples: The hospital's patient care team worked around the clock to help recovery.
I called the customer service department about my billing issue.
Hotel front desk staff helped us check in and find our room.
The security department monitors all entrances to the building.
Public utilities provide essential services like water and electricity to residents.
The IT help desk resolved our computer problems quickly.
negative_examples: The manufacturing company produces automotive parts for export.
Our research team is developing new cancer treatments in the lab.
The sales division exceeded their quarterly revenue targets.
Local government officials passed new zoning regulations today.
The investment firm manages portfolios worth millions of dollars.
Educational institutions offer degree programs to thousands of students.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ProductionOrgs, GovernmentOrgs, EducationalOrgs, FinancialOrgs

candidates.definition: Organizations that create, distribute, or manage media content and communication services.

positive_examples: Netflix announced its new streaming service expansion.
The newspaper published an investigative report on local corruption.
CNN's breaking news alert reached millions of viewers.
Spotify launched a new podcast platform for creators.
The radio station changed its morning show lineup.
Disney acquired the rights to stream classic movies.
negative_examples: The university's communications department sent an email to students.
Microsoft released a new software update for Windows.
The company's marketing team created an advertising campaign.
Tesla announced its quarterly earnings report to investors.
The government issued a public health advisory.
Amazon's customer service responded to product complaints.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: EducationalInstitution, GovernmentAgency, BusinessCorporation, NonProfitOrganization, ReligiousOrganization

candidates.definition: Groups of people organized around shared activities, interests, or collaborative work.

positive_examples: The local chess club meets every Tuesday evening at the community center.
Our university's marching band performed at halftime during the football game.
The basketball league announced the playoff schedule for next month.
The ship's crew worked together to navigate through the storm.
The cross-functional team included engineers, designers, and marketing specialists.
She joined the photography club to meet other enthusiasts in her area.
negative_examples: The corporation announced quarterly earnings that exceeded expectations.
The government agency issued new regulations for environmental protection.
The hospital opened a new wing dedicated to cardiac surgery.
Apple released its latest smartphone model with enhanced features.
The university established a new research institute for artificial intelligence.
The nonprofit foundation donated millions to disaster relief efforts.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Corporation, GovernmentAgency, Institution, Company

candidates.definition: Organizations that engage in political activities, governance, or represent collective interests in public affairs.

positive_examples: The United Nations voted on the climate resolution yesterday.
Local teachers joined the union to negotiate better working conditions.
The Democratic Party announced its platform for the upcoming election.
NATO members discussed military cooperation strategies.
The labor union organized a strike to protest wage cuts.
Several political parties formed a coalition government.
negative_examples: Apple Inc. reported record quarterly profits.
The Red Cross provided disaster relief to flood victims.
Harvard University accepted 2,000 new students this year.
Goldman Sachs announced a new investment fund.
The Catholic Church held mass on Sunday morning.
Microsoft released a software update for Windows.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BusinessCorporation, EducationalInstitution, ReligiousOrganization, CharitableOrganization
